data.enText: very strict and difficult to change
The curriculum was too narrow and too rigid.
data.chText: 课程设置过于狭窄和死板。

data.enText: His rigid adherence to the rules made him unpopular.
data.chText: 他对规则的刻板坚持使得他不受欢迎。

data.enText: not willing to change their ideas or behaviour
data.chText: 固执的；僵化的；一成不变的

data.enText: stiff and difficult to move or bend
data.chText: 坚硬的；不弯曲的；僵直的

data.enText: a rigid support for the tent
She sat upright, her body rigid with fear .
data.chText: 她直挺挺地坐着，吓得浑身发僵。

data.enText: I was bored rigid (= extremely bored) .
the rigidity of the law on this issue
data.chText: 法律在这个问题上的僵化处理

data.enText: the rigidity of the metal bar
The speed limit must be rigidly enforced.
data.chText: 必须严格执行限速规定。

word_means: 严格的，刻板的，不可变更的
具刚性的，刚硬的，坚硬的，坚固的，僵硬的
身体僵直的，不能动弹的，呆住的

means: （法律、制度或体系）严格的，刻板的，不可变更的
（不弯曲、不拉伸而）具刚性的，刚硬的，坚硬的，坚固的，僵硬的
〈空〉硬式的（指有坚固定形外壳容纳容气器的）
（常因震惊或害怕）身体僵直的，不能动弹的，呆住的

ex.enText: Rigid methods of education are no longer popular among students.
ex.chText: 死板的教育方法已不再受学生欢迎。

ex.enText: His rigid adherence to old-fashioned ideas made him unpopular.
ex.chText: 他顽固坚持旧观念使得他不受欢迎。

synonyms.bx: 指方法、体制等僵化的，也指人不通融的。

ex.enText: Guests without invitations have to undergo rigorous safety checks.
ex.chText: 没有邀请函的客人要接受严格的安全检查。

ex.enText: Anyone who failed to meet their rigorous standards would be fired.
ex.chText: 任何不能达到他们严格标准的人都将被开除。

synonyms.bx: 多指检验标准、系统、程序等严格、缜密的，通常作定语。

ex.enText: He is very strict with his students.
Her boss is very strict about punctuality.
ex.chText: 她的老板严格要求守时。

synonyms.bx: 指对人在行为规则上要求严格的。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：刻板的，严格的

tr: incapable of or resistant to bending
example: a table made of rigid plastic
a palace guardsman stiff as a poker

tr: designating an airship or dirigible having a form maintained by a stiff unyielding frame or structure
incapable of adapting or changing to meet circumstances

example: with eyes set in a fixed glassy stare
his bearded face already has a set hollow look"- Connor Cruise O'Brie

example.ex: Several colleges in our study have rigid rules about student conduct...
example.tran: 在我们的研究中，有几所大学制定了严格的学生行为规则。

example.ex: Hospital routines for nurses are very rigid.
example.tran: 医院中护士的日常工作非常刻板。

value.def: Laws, rules, or systems that are rigid cannot be changed or varied, and are therefore considered to be rather severe.
value.tran: (法律、制度或体系)严格的，刻板的，不可变更的

example.ex: The caste system was rigidly enforced.
example.tran: 过去印度的种姓制度非常严格。

example.ex: She was a fairly rigid person who had strong religious views...
example.tran: 她相当顽固，宗教观念极强。

example.ex: My father is very rigid in his thinking.
example.tran: 我父亲的思想非常顽固。

value.def: If you disapprove of someone because you think they are not willing to change their way of thinking or behaving, you can describe them as rigid .
A rigid substance or object is stiff and does not bend, stretch, or twist easily.
value.tran: 坚硬的;刚性的;不易弯曲的

example.ex: Andrew went rigid when he saw a dog, any dog, anywhere.
example.tran: 安德鲁过去只要看见狗，无论在哪里，无论什么狗，都会吓得一动不动。

gramarinfo.label: usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ <l>with</l> n

value.def: If someone goes rigid, their body becomes very straight and stiff, usually as a result of shock or fear.
value.tran: (常因震惊或害怕)身体僵直的，不能动弹的，呆住的

example.ex: She stood rigidly and stared into the room.
example.tran: 她直直地站在那里，凝视着屋内。
